intro: Digraphis americana, commonly known as the American digraphis, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbrella-like arrangements. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed soils.
